com.igeekinc.util.rules

Class IncludeExcludeRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.igeekinc.util.rules.IncludeExcludeRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Rule, java.io.Serializable

    public class IncludeExcludeRule
extends java.lang.Object
implements Rule, java.io.Serializable
    IncludeExcludeRule allows for inclusion/exclusion points to be set within a tree. Internally it contains a sparse tree with nodes for any points where and inclusion/exclusion has been specifically set along with any needed intermediate nodes. When a file is presented to matchesRule(), the file's path is followed through the tree until it hits a leaf node or the path is exhausted. If the path is exhausted first the result always matches. If a leaf node is hit, the result of matchRule is the include value of the leaf node.
    See Also:

        public void init()
        Description copied from interface: Rule
        Called at the beginning of a execution run to allow all rules to reinitialize themselves for the run. Primarily used by relative date rules (e.g. "today") to set their base time.
